answer1: A vector that is normal to the plane containing $u$ and $v$ with norm $\sqrt{3}$.
answer2: A vector parallel to $u$ and $v$ with norm $\sqrt{3}$.
answer3: A vector that is perpendicular to both $u$ and $v$ with norm $2\sqrt{7}$ .
answer4: A vector parallel to $u$ and $v$ with norm $2\sqrt{7}$.

question:

answer1: The sum of the amplitudes of the external angles of any triangle is always equal to $360^\circ$.
answer2: The sum of the amplitudes of the external angles of a convex quadrilateral is always equal to $540^\circ$.
answer3: The sum of the amplitudes of the external angles of a convex pentagon is always equal to  $720^\circ$.

question:

& 3x_{1}+3x_{2}+x_{3}+3x_{4}\leq 36 \text{ (resource 2)}\\
& x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3}, x_{4}\geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]

Knowing that $P$ is a parallelogram, indicate what you can say about $P$.
answer1: The sum of the amplitudes of the internal angles of $P$ is $360^\circ$.

question: Consider the linear transformation  $T:\mathbb{R}^3 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ defined by $T(x,y,z)=(x+y,0,y+z)$. Choose the right answer.

&5x &- &10y &+ &10z &= &8 \\
&-x &+ &2y &+ &z &= &-2 \\

\end{cases}$$

answer4: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameters.

\[\begin{array}{ll}
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1} + 2x_{2}\\
\text{subject to} & x_{1}\leq 4\\
& 2x_{2}\leq 12\\
& 3x_{1}+2x_{2}\leq 18\\
& 3x_{1}+5x_{2}\leq 40\\
&  x_{1},x_{2}\geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]
answer1: All the points on the line segment connecting  $x_{1}=2 ,~x_{2}=6$ and $x_{1}=4 ,~x_{2}=3$ are optimal.

question:
Four workers ($W_1$, $W_2$, $W_3$ and $W_4$) should be selected to perform three different tasks ($T_1$, $T_2$ and $T_3$), for which they are unequally prepared. Based on the qualifications and previous experience, it was possible to construct the following table which indicates, for each worker $j$, the operation time in each task  $i$ (in weeks):
	
\[
\begin{array}{l|cccc|}
& W_1 & W_2 & W_3 & W_4 \\
\hline
T_1 & 2 & 6 & 7 & 4 \\
T_2 & 9 & 8 & 4 & 2 \\
T_3 & 2& 7 & 5 & 7 \\
\hline 
\end{array}
\]	

Supposing that the several tasks start at same time, what workers should be selected to complete all the three tasks as soon as possible?

Let $f$ be the function defined by
\[
f(x)=
\frac{|\sin (x)|}{\cos (x)}+\frac{\cos (x)}{|\sin (x)|}.
\]
What is the domain of $f$?

Consider in the three-dimensional cartesian system the plane of equation $\pi: 2x-3y+z-1=0$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(-1, -1, 0)$ and is normal to the vector $n=(-4, 6, -2)$.
answer2: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, 1, 0)$ and is parallel to the vector $n=(2, 3, 1)$.
answer3: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, 1, 1)$ and is normal to the vector $n=(2, -3, 1)$.
answer4: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, -1, 0)$ and is parallel to the vector $n=(2, -3, 1)$.

question:
Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{C}^2\right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
(1+i)z& + & (1-i)w & = & i \\
(1-i)z& + & (1+i)w & = & 1-i
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The unique solution of the linear system is $\bigg(\frac{3+i}{4},-\frac{1+i}{4}\bigg)$.
answer2: The solutions of the linear system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{1+i}{4},\frac{-1+i}{4}+z\bigg)$, for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer3: The linear system has no solutions.
answer4: The linear system has the vector $(i,-i)$ has its unique solution.

answer4: $(1,1)$ and $(-1,-1)$ are minima and $(0,0)$ is a saddle point.
